adjective.description: Electricity (Of an electric current or signal) exhibiting a single phase; (of an electrical device) operating on a single phase.
Physical Chemistry. Of a substance or mixture: consisting of a single phase.
Science. Of a process, or a curve representing it: occurring or performed in a single stage.

noun.description: Physical Chemistry. A substance or mixture consisting of a single phase.

origin: Early 20th century; earliest use found in Encyclopaedia Britannica. From mono- + phase. Compare French monophasé.
